column3: Success and failure are greatly overrated. But failure gives you a whole lot more to talk about.
Fear of failure must never be a reason not to try something.
Foreign aid is neither a failure nor a panacea. It is, instead, an important tool of American policy that can serve the interests of the United States and the world if wisely administered.
Failure is a part of success.

Why do I talk about the benefits of failure? Simply because failure meant a stripping away of the inessential. I stopped pretending to myself that I was anything other than what I was, and began to direct all my energy into finishing the only work that mattered to me.

If I were not African, I wonder whether it would be clear to me that Africa is a place where the people do not need limp gifts of fish but sturdy fishing rods and fair access to the pond. I wonder whether I would realize that while African nations have a failure of leadership, they also have dynamic people with agency and voices.

There is a no-man's land in our politics: on the one hand, bounded by what we know to be true, and on the other hand, bounded by what the media says is politically correct. And that's where Donald Trump lives. And it's our failure to admit what we all know to be true in the guise of political correctness that fuels the Trump candidacy.
Destiny: A tyrant's authority for crime and a fool's excuse for failure.

My failures may be my greatest successes. It is in failure that I have often drawn closer to God, learn to depend more on Him than myself, gained self-knowledge, and seen things in their right perspective.
I've had a lot of success; I've had failures, so I learn from the failure.
In politics, what begins in fear usually ends in failure.
Man is not made for defeat.
I don't believe in failure. It is not failure if you enjoyed the process.
Success isn't permanent and failure isn't fatal.
The way most people fail is in not keeping up the heart.

All that is necessary to break the spell of inertia and frustration is this: Act as if it were impossible to fail. That is the talisman, the formula, the command of right about face which turns us from failure to success.
Why should anybody be interested in some old man who was a failure?
My father was not a failure. After all, he was the father of a president of the United States.
It really is impossible not to like him. His success was his failure.
The failure of women to have reached positions of leadership has been due in large part to social and professional discrimination.
You have to look at the history of the Middle East in particular. It has been one of failure and frustration, of feudalism and tribalism.
You cannot learn anything from success, you only learn from failure.
Keep in mind that neither success nor failure is ever final.
War is failure of diplomacy.

In a sense it might even be said that our failure is to form habits: for, after all, habit is relative to a stereotyped world, and meantime it is only the roughness of the eye that makes two persons, things, situations, seem alike.
The reason was the failure of both Japan and China to understand each other and the inability of America and the European powers to sympathize, without prejudice, with the peoples of East Asia.
